intro: Intybus multicaulis, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features a hairy stem with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Intybus multicaulis is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
